properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Blackwood, Greendale, Lerderderg. 
  • There is a bushfire at Greendale that is under control.
  • Firefighters with machinery will continue to work on the fire and the surrounding areas.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 10:50 am, Monday 9 February 2026.

Impacts in your area: 
  • All roads in the Lerderberg State Park are closed including: Obriens Road between Greendale-Trentham Road and Bluegum Track.
  • The Lerderderg State Park is closed to all visitors including campers, runners and walkers.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

- The Lerderderg State Park is closed to all visitors including campers, runners and walkers.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Reedy Creek, Strath Creek. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 8:02pm Tuesday 17 February.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Incident Location: Goulburn Valley Hwy, Trawool
Issue Date: Wednesday 18 February 2026, 03:03 am
Next Update: Thursday 19 February 2026, 03:10 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41346/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Reedy Creek, Strath Creek. 
- This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 8:02pm Tuesday 17 February. 


People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Granite, Kerrisdale, Tallarook, Trawool.
  • There is a bushfire at Goulburn Valley Hwy, Trawool that is not yet under control.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice Message issued earlier today.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond. 
  • Be aware of emergency vehicles travelling in the area.
  • A relief centre is open at Yea Recreation Reserve located at 20 Snodgrass Street Yea.
  • Animals can be brought to the relief centre. Pets must be caged. Dogs can be tied up. Cattle pens are available for large animals. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Speed restrictions are in place near the Trawool Fire Station.
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 18/02/2026 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: between the townships of  Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand. 
  • This Community Information replaces the message issued on 17 February 2026. 
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters remain on site to continuing to extinguish hotspots. 
  • Crews and heavy machinery are working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground.
There is currently no threat to communities however you should stay informed of fire and weather conditions. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: North of Strath Creek, South of Trawool and West of King Parrot Creek Road Kerrisdale
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for North of Strath Creek, South of Trawool and West of King Parrot Creek Road Kerrisdale. 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return to areas North of Strath Creek, South of Trawool and West of King Parrot Creek Road Kerrisdale. 
  • There is a bushfire South of the Goulburn Valley Hwy, Trawool that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is slow moving due to the change in weather conditions.
If you have left the area, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards and emergency vehicles.

What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
  • A relief centre is open at Yea Recreation Reserve located at 20 Snodgrass Street.
  • Animals can be brought to the Relief Centre - Pets must be caged. Dogs can be tied up. Cattle pens are available for larger animals.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:

  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
  • Be aware of emergency vehicles travelling in the area.
  • Speed restrictions are in place near the Trawool Fire Station
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority. 

The next update is expected by 18/02/2026 07:00 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return
Incident Location: Goulburn Valley Hwy, Trawool
Issue Date: Wednesday 18 February 2026, 03:00 am
Next Update: Wednesday 18 February 2026, 07:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41343/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for North of Strath Creek, South of Trawool and West of King Parrot Creek Road Kerrisdale. 
-  It is Not Safe to Return to areas North of Strath Creek, South of Trawool and West of King Parrot Creek Road Kerrisdale. 
- There is a bushfire South of the Goulburn Valley Hwy, Trawool that is not yet under control. 
- The bushfire is slow moving due to the change in weather conditions.


If you have left the area, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards and emergency vehicles. 


What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
- Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
- Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
- Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
- A relief centre is open at Yea Recreation Reserve located at 20 Snodgrass Street. 
- Animals can be brought to the Relief Centre -  Pets must be caged. Dogs can be tied up. Cattle pens are available for larger animals.
- Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice Message issued on 13 February 2026.
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters remain on site to continue to extinguish any remaining hotspots.
  • Crews assisted by heavy machinery are  working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
